holidays.name: National Blueberry Popsicle Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the sweet, refreshing burst of summer with a frozen blueberry popsicle! Perfect for cooling down in the warming late summer days, this quirky holiday honors a tasty treat made from nature's little blue jewels.
holidays.origin: This unofficial food holiday was created by frozen treat enthusiasts to appreciate unique popsicle flavors beyond the usual fruit options.
holidays.funFact: Blueberries are one of the only fruits native to North America and are packed with antioxidants, making your popsicle not just delicious but also a little nutritious!

holidays.name: Be Late for Something Day
holidays.description: Embrace the thrill and mild panic of being fashionably late! This day encourages people to relax standards of punctuality and enjoy life without rushing.
holidays.origin: Started in the 1980s as a whimsical protest against rigid schedules and time pressures of modern life.
holidays.funFact: Studies say being a little late can actually reduce stress ‚Äî so this holiday might be secretly good for you!

holidays.name: National Beard Day
holidays.description: A celebration of facial hair in all its glorious forms! Whether a full beard, goatee, or scruffy stubble, today honors the art and attitude of grown-up fuzz.
holidays.origin: Began in the early 2000s to counter the stigma around beards and empower those growing facial hair.
holidays.funFact: During World War I, many men grew beards to protect their skin from chemical attacks ‚Äî talk about practical style!

holidays.name: Tattoo Removal Day
holidays.description: This day helps people reflect on their old tattoos they might be ready to remove or modify, symbolizing how personal expression evolves over time.
holidays.origin: Invented by tattoo removal clinics in the late 2010s to raise awareness about tattoo removal options and promote skin health.
holidays.funFact: Laser tattoo removal can require up to 10 sessions, but new technology is making the process faster and less painful.
